title: Tilapia Veracruz
summary: Tilapia Veracruz is a gluten free, primal, fodmap friendly, and pescatarian recipe with 35 servings. One portion of this dish contains about 4g of protein, 1g of fat, and a total of 30 calories. For 42 cents per serving, this recipe covers 2% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. 1 person found this recipe to be yummy and satisfying. If you have cilantro, cheddar jack cheese, lime juice, and a few other ingredients on hand, you can make it. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes roughly 35 minutes. With a spoonacular score of 29%, this dish is not so spectacular. Try Veracruz Style Tilapia, Tilapia Veracruz With Cilantro Rice Recipe, and Tilapian in Mushroom Sauce (Tilapian en Salsa de Champiñones) for similar recipes.

winePairing.pairingText: Tilapian on the menu? Try pairing with Pinot Grigio, Gruener Veltliner, and Pinot Noir. Fish is as diverse as wine, so it's hard to pick wines that go with every fish. A crisp white wine, such as a pinot grigio or Grüner Veltliner, will suit any delicately flavored white fish. Meaty, strongly flavored fish such as salmon and tuna can even handle a light red wine, such as a pinot noir. You could try Mark West Pinot Grigio. Reviewers quite like it with a 4.5 out of 5 star rating and a price of about 13 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Mark West Pinot Grigio
productMatches.description:
Crisp and clean, this wine features honeydew, stone fruit, and citrus with a subtle, clean, lingering finish.
Try pairing with good old fish and chips, summer salads, and steamed clams by the dozen...or dozens.

instructions: Heat oven to 400F.                                            Mix dressing and juice.  Place fish in 13x9-inch baking dish; drizzle with 1/2 the dressing mixture.  Toss tomatoes and olives with remaining dressing mixture.                                            Bake fish 20 min.; top with tomato mixture and cheese.  Bake 5 min. or until cheese is melted and fish flakes easily with fork.                                              Sprinkle with cilantro.

steps.step: Place fish in 13x9-inch baking dish; drizzle with 1/2 the dressing mixture.  Toss tomatoes and olives with remaining dressing mixture.
Bake fish 20 min.; top with tomato mixture and cheese.
Bake 5 min. or until cheese is melted and fish flakes easily with fork.
